title: Semester-Long TryHackMe CTF Series
description: A 12-week challenge series releasing three TryHackMe offensive security labs weekly, covering OSINT, forensics, reverse engineering, malware, cryptography, networking, penetration testing, and web security. Open all semester with technical support.

title: Game Off 2025 Collaboration
description: Weekly Wednesday sessions with Cyber Security, Computer Science, and Data Science societies to plan and develop entries for the Itch.io Game Off 2025. Includes brainstorming, prototyping, gameplay development, reverse engineering, and collaborative security analysis.

title: Bi-Weekly Online Meets
description: Community-driven online meets for games, open discussion, event planning, and ideation sessions. Designed to build connections across members.

title: BCU Open Day (Computing Stand)
description: Represented the Cyber Security Society at the BCU Open Day. Spoke with prospective computing and cybersecurity students, introduced the society’s purpose and activities, and supported course leaders during demonstrations.

title: Cyber Security Awareness Event
description: Talks on the impact of cybercrime, cybersecurity career paths, phishing challenges, Google phishing game, sender-verification exercises, Kahoot quiz, and pizza.

title: Big Welcome 2025 Stall
location: BCU Big Welcome Fair, City Centre Campus
description: The society’s launch event at the Big Welcome Fair. Helped new students across tech degrees, answered questions, gave demos, and led to a 760% membership increase (from 5 to 40+ members).
